name: fish freezing plant construction and maintenance | fish freezing plant | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/18574/documentation

The activity represents the construction and maintenance along its lifetime of a fish freezing (including fish pre-processing) plant, expressed as the installed capacity required to process 1000 kg of raw material. The life cycle inventories were produced based on a sample of 1 Peruvian plant (processing capacity: 16 200 t/y) and data from other industry representatives.;System boundaries of fish processing plants and relations between activities

From construction of the plant, through maintenance.

End of life treatment of the plant
category: F:Construction/42:Civil engineering/429:Construction of other civil engineering projects/4290:Construction of other civil engineering projects

processDocumentation.timeDescription: Production figures represent the period 2012. Valid as of 2017.
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Representative of Peru, as of 2017 there were 127 active fish canning plants, with an aggregated processing capacity of 3.29 million t/y.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Construction and maintenance activities of Peruvian fish freezing plants, per t of processing capacity. Plants have a lifespan of 30 years.;Process diagram of small fish freezing
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Data from one plant were extrapolated on the basis of built area and processing capacity to represent any plant of the same type, regardless of size.

exchanges.description: One unit of plant represents the installed capacity required to process 1 t of raw material, including annual maintenance of the infrastructure, over the plant's lifetime.

flow.name: fish freezing plant
